website_summaries.verdict: A lower-priced DSLR for mid-level photographers.
pros: Helpful shake reduction feature reduces blur
Lots of features for a mid-level camera
cons: Video quality is not on par with competitors
No WiFi but can buy a memory card to enable it
Novice users may have difficulty learning how to use it

website_summaries.verdict: The Pentax K-3 II D-SLR adds some features to its predecessor, including an in-camera GPS, but does so at the cost of the built-in flash.
pros: Pixel Shift Resolution shooting mode improves detail
cons: Astrotracer function is hit or miss
Burst rate slows when tracking focus is enabled

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing APS-C camera. I have been a Pentax DSLR user for many years and upgraded to the K-3 II from a K200D and couldn't be happier. While I loved the 200D, this camera is light years ahead in every way. Very rugged, excellent build quality and fit and finish, amazing features and lots of buttons means less fumbling around in various menus. A GPS receiver replaces a built-in flash, but that is ok, I use an external flash anyway and the GPS is very helpful if you want to return to that perfect spot. Excellent camera and great price!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy K Franklin

customer_reviews.title: two thumbs up for a great camera.
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from the K5 and the improvements incorporated into this model are superb. I am a semi-pro photographer and find the image quality to be excellent and the low light performance as well as focus accuracy to be outstanding. Focus peaking at high magnification in live view has been a real treat for me as well, enabling me to nail focus every time. I have been using the GPS via the )GPS1 accessory for several years and having the device built into the camera was a brilliant idea.
customer_reviews.author: mike o

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value prosumer DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Excellent prosumer digital camera. One of the best camera bodies you can buy with an APS-C sized sensor. Lightning fast operation, excellent automatic white balance, excellent automatic exposure that seems to handle even complex scenarios, high dynamic range. Really liking it so far.
customer_reviews.author: EuropeanAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from the K-50 and absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the K-50 and absolutely love this camera. It is far less forgiving than the K-50 was and I wouldn't say it would be a good camera for a beginner. I purchased it for hiking, I carry this plus a few small primes or a small zoom depending on the hike. The solid build quality and weather resistance means I am not worried about the equipment when I am hiking. Pair this with some good lenses like the DFA 100 Macro and the 15 limited and you have a killer set. I plan on taking this along with 3 primes on a 200 mile hike in the Sierras this year.
customer_reviews.author: Bakerking31

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding camera! Wonderful low-light photography thanks to the improved built-in shake reduction. Superb clarity and extremely low noise! I was a fan of the K3 and am a BIGGER fan of the K3II!! Bravo Ricoh!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Durrenberger

customer_reviews.title: this is my first Pentax and i like the camera very much
customer_reviews.text: very please with the camera, i switched from Canon, this is my first Pentax and i like the camera very much, great outdoor capabilities, mostly i use it for outdoor photography and architectural photography, i have done also portrait photography and its just a very versatile, well made camera. It suits my needs. I have shot under rain and had no problems, great image quality, just be careful with high ISO with very little light, past 6400 you can see some noise showing, other than that its a perfect all around camera.
customer_reviews.author: Julio Herrera

customer_reviews.title: This One Is A Real Gem
customer_reviews.text: Great camera in all aspects. I performed A-B comparisons with my Canon 6D and was amazed at the quality of the K-3ii files. Best thing is the backward lens compatibility. I can use all my older Pentax glass.
customer_reviews.author: JLA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade from my K5 IIs
customer_reviews.text: Excellent upgrade from my K5 IIs. No more TTL flash metering problems. And I pulled out my 30+ year old Tamron 80-200mm f/2.8 manual focus zoom lens, and it works great. Of course the f/stop and shutter speed must be set manually.
customer_reviews.author: jamartinez

customer_reviews.title: Regardless of my bad experience with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of my bad experience with this camera, returning two items because of factory defect, I must say that this is most solid built body I have ever seen. and you will not be able to feel it by just seeing pictures until you hold it in your hands. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Levan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Pentax gear since the early '90s. Pentax cameras and lenses have always exceeded my expectations and my capabilities as an amateur photographer. This camera is no different - Superb quality, built like a tank, and features that will keep me learning for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Davis

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With This Camera
customer_reviews.text: Intuitive ergonomics and menu, beautiful detailed images. Easy to expose for highlights and recover shadow detail.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: This was a great upgrade. It takes out of the world great ...
customer_reviews.text: Pentax is one of top three camera in the world. Used Pentax for the last 40 years and never had a problem with any of the cameras. This was a great upgrade. It takes out of the world great photos and the workmanship is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: George H.

customer_reviews.title: A great camera, the features built into the body are ...
customer_reviews.text: A great camera, the features built into the body are a valuable asset and the sensor produces amazing images when paired with good lenses. My 50mm Pentax f 1.4 is a go to setup for this body and the color rendering is amazing moving from the Kr to the k3ii.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Mills

customer_reviews.title: Very useful camera with rich functionality, excellent picture quality and compatibility with old lenses.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the camera. Not used for professional snaps, just enthusiast. I appreciate very much the compatibility of lenses from old Pentax film SLRs, even manual lenses are working well. Great functionality, pixel shift, image stabilisation in camera body. Built in sensitive GPS is nice, actually no flash, so external one is a must. This DSLR construction is very solid, weather sealed. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pavol Suja

customer_reviews.title: This camera has fantastic image quality and enough customization to be able to ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm impressed. This camera has fantastic image quality and enough customization to be able to do most anything. Equal to my Canon's in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Terry W. Overton Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Very Sharp Images
customer_reviews.text: This camera is excellent. I've used Pentax for many years. The removal of Tha AA filter gives very sharp images. They're sharp even at 100% crop.
customer_reviews.author: Harry W FArrell Jr

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the newest version of Pentax K cameras
customer_reviews.text: Camera works very well. I am very happy with the newest version of Pentax K cameras. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Leroy Nagasako

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing camera, it feels well constructed and is really ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera, it feels well constructed and is really ergonomic. It also has an excellent color rendition and awesome resolution. I personally think this camera provides the best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Jouko Kallio

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, excluding the FLU card
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, excluding the FLU card. This is a great camera that matches or exceeds those of higher priced competitors. Have had professional photographers come away impressed with the camera vowing to trade in a Cannon for this model. The FLU card is not all it's cracked up to be. It seems more like an afterthought or rip off of over wifi cards. Highly recommend this camera, but watch the price for a few days prior to buying. It seems to fluctuate more than other items.
customer_reviews.author: pm9r33n

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pentax is a great brand and makes superb cameras. This takes great photos.
customer_reviews.author: Geoworker

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and works great. Thanks for the bargain price on a high quality camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Feels great on hand(you'll understand when you go at your camera store and try one). The buttons are on the sweet spots where you could easily press them while taking pictures. Only use PSR on tripod. Weather sealing is great. Works well with vintage lenses. Live view is great. The built-in shake reduction works really well for me. I generally prefer built-in geo tagging(depends on what you shoot, I shoot street and landscape)than the flash cause I never really use the built-in flash. This camera is best for outdoor photography(hiking, beach, street, forest, wildlife, etc), and it doesn't give a damn about the weather. Durable body, you could shoot with this camera all day. (with extra batteries ofc)
customer_reviews.author: Pentaxian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design for flagship APS-C camera
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it's a Pentax! Much better performance than I anticipated for a 25 Megapixel sensor.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. S.

customer_reviews.title: a remarkable camera
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to use for nature photography a sigma 150-500 rides on it most often together they make some great shaots
customer_reviews.author: craig

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love Pentax products. Great camera. Lots of features. Great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Shalitha S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect@slim body@amazon best choice. I have both nikon d300s and pentax k3II, l love them.
customer_reviews.author: DAmao

customer_reviews.title: Has more capabilities than I need but does a great job. I am still getting familiar with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Has more capabilities than I need but does a great job. I am still getting familiar with it so will not say more at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look at my photo and decide.
customer_reviews.text: Look at the photo I took with this baby. Google all the features of this camera. Then buy it from this seller. I didn't buy a Canon. Being super skeptical I decided to buy a USED PENTAX for its great review, weather proofing and astrotracer. This seller delivered a quality used camera at a great price. Again. Look at my unretouched photo and decide if this is your camera. Nouf said
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. A big step up from my K5 in ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. A big step up from my K5 in resolution, auto-focus, color accuracy, and lens stabilization. I just wish it had the pop up flash instead of the GPS which I never use. It's kind of a pain in the neck to have to carry a flash unit with me wherever I go and I never use the GPS anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Yonatan

customer_reviews.title: A nice step up from my K5IIs which finally gave out ...
customer_reviews.text: A nice step up from my K5IIs which finally gave out after taking close to a half a million bracketed shots. I like this camera body enough that I think I will keep from throwing it into the ocean.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Looked like a nice camera...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used camera worked briefly but one day turned the camera on and the Auto Focus was messed up would focus just saw little red lights dancing around the viewfinder. Long and short returned camera.
customer_reviews.author: Crow T Robot

customer_reviews.title: Beastly capacities
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing machine, so versatile and consistent, fast raw file storage, multiple exposure types.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera with weather sealing
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera, a little outdated but with a solid and robust construction (weather sealed), and to get effective sealing you need to use a WR lens like this one:  This camera works with old Pentax lenses, and the focus motor embedded in the body is very fast. The processing power is fast, but it demands a fast card like this one:
customer_reviews.author: Everton Onofre

customer_reviews.title: Good camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera, the only niggle I have is the on/off switch placement. I would have preferred it placed somewhere else. I'm used to 1D series Canons so that might be the reason. (It's really lightweight compared to the big Canons).
customer_reviews.author: JJP

customer_reviews.title: One complaint is that there is no tilting screen which I think can be very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Very capable teched-up WR camera. One complaint is that there is no tilting screen which I think can be very useful.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera. I love pentax
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera. I love pentax. But they have to improve their autofocusing. Good thing I'm old school and know how to adjust
customer_reviews.author: Keith Swanson

customer_reviews.title: but if the reviews are accurate I should be very happy with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Haven't really had a chance to put it through it's paces yet, but if the reviews are accurate I should be very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mastroianna

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, I know what I'm talking about
customer_reviews.text: Long time Pentax user, and this is junk or at least the one I got was. I love my K5 IIs... thought I would upgrade, images not as sharp as I would like, it had trouble with the auto focus feature and yes I'm a professional photographer... this camera almost makes me want to give up on Pentax and that is saying a lot considering I have owned a couple dozen of them. sad...
customer_reviews.author: Bob’s your uncle

product_meta.title: Pentax K-3II Pentax DSLR (Body Only)
product_meta.description: Designed for the top performance of the K series, the K-3II provides an array of outstanding features, including high-resolution image reproduction with approximately 24 effective megapixels; a 27-point AF system; high-speed continuous shooting at approximately 8.3 images per second; high-precision exposure control with a newly designed 86,000 pixel RGB light-metering sensor; a new, large, high-resolution LCD monitor, an optical viewfinder with the largest, brightness subject image in its class; and built in GPS and compass with sensor shift for Astro photography in compact form factor. The new AA simulator - a highly innovative function developed specifically for the K-3II - allows the user to effectively minimize moiré without actually installing an optical AA filter in the camera, providing a choice of filtered or filter-free shooting for a given scene or subject. The K-3II also offers pixel shift resolution technology that moves the image sensor unit in minute increments, a single pixel pitch at a time, to capture four shots. Pixel Shift Resolution merges those shots into a single image to generate an ultra high-definition image. This difference makes it excellent for detail and color reproduction, creating super high-definition images. The time-proven dustproof, weather-resistant body construction ensures dependable, flawless performance in the field.
feature_bullets: 24 effective mega-pixels in an APS-C sized CMOS sensor with ISO range of 100-51200.Resolution:24.35 Megapixels
Built-in GPS with Astro Tracer Function for Astro photography with built in compass function
Pixel Shift Resolution by in body shake reduction function for razor sharp images with excellent detail and color reproduction
FLU, Eye-fi Wireless, and SDX Memory card compatibility for easy image transfer to mobile devices and remote control of camera

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars83 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
